name: Balmoral Inn

reviews.title: Very Clean and Comfortable
reviews.text: I love the express check-in and how clean the room was upon arrival. Very impressive views of the old city from my room. And the beds are so comforatable....It was the best sleep I had for a long time. I slept late and I could still have breakfast. I will return!

reviews.title: An Exellent Choice!
reviews.text: There are many beautiful bed and breakfast establishments in St. john’s, it may a bit challenging to pick one, specially in the downtown area. The heritage area of downtown is a bit pricy but it is well worth it, it is so convenient and so different in style. The most convenient location in Downtown is the Queen’s Road where there are number of heritage B&Bs and Inns like; Bluestone Inn, Abba Inn, Cantwel House B&B, Balmoral Inn and it is the Center of Downtown, walking distance to everything. We stayed in couple of those establishments, but Balmoral Inn is our favorite. It was the first establishment on Queen’s Road, experienced staff and is olso very well maintained. It is a pleasure to be there. Very comfortable! For us it was an excellent choice.

reviews.title: Very Tranquil and peaceful
reviews.text: Balmoral Inn was a very enjoyable experience for me. My room was delightful with a georgous view of the old city. The bed was exceptionally comfortable and the room was spacious. I enjoyed the peace and quiet there. It was very tranquil and relaxing. I didn't even rent a car because the Balmoral Inn is the center of downtown. It was great.

reviews.title: Beautiful European-style B&B
reviews.text: David is Bulgarian and Kim is a Newfoundlander and they have created a beautiful B&B with high ceilings, ornate moldings and bold wall papers. Each room is spacious and some have harbour views. We stayed in two different rooms and they were both en-suites. The breakfast was very good served continental style. We very much enjoyed our stay there in Newfoundland.

My husband and I visited St. John's last November and stayed 3 nights at the Balmoral Inn. As it is a business/leisure trip, I wanted to stay in a place that is both homelike and also convenient as an office. The Balmoral inn definitely meets the former criterion, but not the latter.
reviews.title: Unique B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is a 3-story home with Victorian-style decorations. (If you prefer the modern decor, you may not like the over-the-top decorations there.) We were the only guests during our stay, so we had a lot of privacy.
reviews.title: better than expected

reviews.text: Our room is on the second floor and is pretty standard for the type of houses built in late 1890's or 1900's. It has a bay window facing the street, and one can get a glimmer of the distant harbour from the window. The closets are very small, again, to be expected. One thing I definitely do not like is the lack of a desk/table in the bedroom, and I could not work on my laptop comfortably. It does have free wireless Internet. The bathroom is very small also with little space to hang towels and clothes. It does not have a tub either. It is definitely not the kind of 4-star hotel bathroom, but it is clean and adequate.
reviews.title: Excellent spot - would go back

likes.liked: — Location, freedom/flexibility of eating, coming and going; design of building

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The dining room is downstairs on the main floor, next to the kitchen. Every morning, the table would be set and the coffee made, though we never saw anyone during our entire stay there. One helps oneself to cereals, fruits, muffins, and other stuff one can find in the kitchen fridge. On our last day there, we bought a few things from the supermarket and cooked a simple dinner at the Inn (this is something you definitely cannot do at the usual B&B or hotels).
reviews.title: Lovely
Not really a B&B
reviews.text: The living room has a few chairs and a sofa, but one convenience is the computer desk with a PC and a printer.

I stayed here while in St. John's and was very impressed withthe location and the helpfulness of David and Kimberley the owners. Most of all I appreciated the peace and tranquility of my quiet, well-appointed period -piece room which included cable connection to the Internet.
reviews.title: Peaceful

likes.disliked: — No bath tub in my room

reviews.title: Spectacular
reviews.text: Excellent location. Quiet clean and comfortable. I stayed in St. John's much longer than anticipated so shuffled arounf some.

reviews.title: Balmoral - clean quiet and comfortable
reviews.text: A little treasure right in the middle of th City. I loved the fact that we had privacy but our host was just a phone call away. We could come and go as we pleased and still had acess to enjoy a coffee or sit in their lovely Parlour. A most visit for all. Great work Balmoral Inn.

I loved the quietness after a day running around. I didn't feel like i had to entertain the hosts. The rooms were quiet and spacious and clean. Access to the kitchen was a great bonus as I am on a restricted diet.
reviews.title: Difficult to say

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Quiet, clean, comfortable, elegant, classy, convenient. What else is there to say. I will certainly stay there next time I am in St. John's. This is the frist tiem I used Trip Advisor reports and it is nice to be able to say something positive
reviews.title: Quiet Elegance within a stroll of everything downtown

likes.disliked: — Early morning traffic a bit ........ next time I woul dask for a back room and pass on the views

reviews.title: Great location
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights at the end of September after touring Newfoundland for past 10 days. Our room on the 2nd floor was large with an ensuite bathroom (shower), gas fireplace, queen bed, and comfortable seating. We did not miss not having a view of the harbour. The location was great for touring the downtown area of St. John's and we walked everywhere. The breakfast was certainly adequate with choice of numerous cereals, breads, and jams and was enjoyed in a lovely dining room. Since it was self-catered we did not have to be at breakfast as any particular time as long as it was before 10:00 am. This old house has been very nicely restored and we enjoyed our stay here very much. We enjoyed visiting with other guests at breakfast but this is a B & B where you can enjoy your privacy as well.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was very pleased with our choice to stay at Balmoral Inn. What a beautiful couple that are running the place. David is European and Kimberly is a Newfoundlander, they are very friendly and make you fell very welcome. There is a computer with internet access for all the guest to use in the living room which was great. As well there was a connection in my room.
reviews.title: Well recommended Love it

likes.liked: — After midnight express check in and Breakfast available until 10:30 each day.

reviews.text: Right across the street there is an excellent restaurant call "Restaurant 21" best food I've ever tasted.
reviews.title: Extremely satisfied !

reviews.text: Just behind the Inn, there is a new museum call the Rooms, and next to that is the Basilica.
reviews.title: Crap

likes.disliked: — Poor breakfast, located up steep hill, no personal B and B style service

description: Conveniently located in the Center of Downtown, Balmoral Inn offers the following amenities: Air-conditioned large rooms, En-suite bathrooms, Ocean view, High-speed internet cable connections in each room, Remote control Color TVs. Private-phone numbers in each room, Room service, etc.
